channel.title: [Guide] How to make Hash oil
channel.description:
This is one of the ways I know how to do it, although there are many ways, this I have found is the simplest way.
Items Needed:
[ul][li]Porcelain pot or heat resistant pyrex bowl, one which is suitable for use in the oven.[/li] [li]cast iron skillet (frying pan larger than the porcelin pot)[/li] [li]Coffee filters (the re-usable gold filters work very well as well, these can be bought at supermarkets)[/li] [li]2 bowls[/li] [li]isopropyl alcohol (rubbing alcohol, try and get something that is 99% pure)[/li][/ul]
Take 1 coffee filter, and place your marijuana in it. Pour the alcohol over the marijuana in the coffee filter so that the alcohol drains into one of the bowls. Squeeze every bit of the alcohol from the marijuana into the bowl.
Now transfer the same marijuana into a clean coffee filter, and use the same alcohol to pour over it again into the second bowl.
Keep repeating this over and over again. If you have a problem with the coffee filters breaking apart while you are squeezing the marijuana, use 2 or 3 coffee filters at a time. The alcohol will turn green.
Next, take the iron skillet set it on the stove, and put the porcelain pot into the skillet. Fill the skillet with water.
[ul][li]Alcohol is extrememly flamable. Don't be stupid, be CAREFUL![/li] [li]Do not cook the alcohol over the open flame. The water in the skillet assists in preventing the alcohol from getting too hot and helps to prevent the alcohol from igniting on fire.[/li] [li]Ensure your kitchen has good ventelation. Use the stove fan and other fans to move the air around in order to prevent fumes from gathering in one place and igniting.[/li][/ul]
Let the alcohol in the porcelain pot in the skillet simmer on "[b]LOW[/b]". Make sure the skillet remains full of water. The alcohol will evaporate very very quickly. Make sure you do not let it evaporate too quickly or burn the alcohol.
Once all the alcohol has been evaporated off, you will be left with hash oil. Take a razor blade and scrape it up and smoke it.
Credit to concept420.
